glsa.title: XStream: Remote execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in XStream may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: XStream is a simple library to serialize objects to XML and back again.

description.p: It was found that XStream would deserialize arbitrary user-supplied XML content, thus representing objects of any type.

impact.p: A remote attacker could pass a specially crafted XML document to XStream, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All XStream users should upgrade to the latest version:
